intro: Zornia albolutescens, commonly known as the white-veined zornia, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, trifoliate leaves with pale veins. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Zornia albolutescens is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
